brief_summary.textblock: CLEAR SYNERGY is an international multi center 2x2 randomized placebo controlled trial of

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are randomized to the drug RCT portion of the CLEAR SYNERGY (OASIS 9) trial

clinical_study.official_title: Studies on the Effects of Colchicine on Neutrophil Biology in Acute Myocardial Infarction: A Substudy of the CLEAR SYNERGY (OASIS 9) Trial

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

primary_outcome.description: Change in soluble L-selectin between baseline and 3 mo after STEMI in the placebo vs. colchicine groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Other soluble markers of neutrophil activity
secondary_outcome.description: Other markers of neutrophil activity will be evaluated at baseline and 3 months after STEMI (myeloperoxidase, matrix metalloproteinase-9, neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin, neutrophil elastase, intercellular/vascular cellular adhesion molecules)
Markers of systemic inflammation will be evaluated at baseline and 3 months after STEMI (high sensitive CRP, IL-1Î²)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neutrophil-driven responses that may further propagate injury
secondary_outcome.description: Neutrophil-driven responses that may further propagate injury will be evaluated at baseline and 3 months after STEMI (neutrophil extracellular traps, neutrophil-derived microparticles)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 19, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

intervention.description: Participants in the main CLEAR SYNERGY trial are randomized to colchicine/spironolactone versus placebo in a 2x2 factorial design. The substudy is interested in the evaluation of biospecimens obtained from patients in the colchicine vs placebo group.
